column4: because you know nothing can go wrong thats notyour fault you feel intimidated?
:P
ok i just copied my accounting files from my home (ext3) to a floppy (ext2) and the folder in the floppy takes up about 90 bytes less, is that ok?
the folder will take up space proportionate to the number of files it has to reference
sorry 90 kilobytes
chanon, thats kind of a non answer
that was for you^
90KB folder is not unusually if you have a lot of files in the folder
unusual
but that is a difference between to supposedly exact folders
the only difference is that one is ext2 and the other ext3
the bigger one is the ext3?
yes
ext3 is just ext2 with logging. I assume that is the space taken up by the logs. I don't know more about ext3 than that
then it might be considered ok to have a file difference like that
In short the extra space is taken up by metadata
thats good enough for now, thank you
is it a file or a directory ? I thought you said directory?
yes directory
OK then yes it is probably what I said
i said file when i meant to type size :P
thanks for the help gnight :)
I wouldn't worry about it unless you want to understand ext3 and filesystem internals
cya
